sn2.9:1.2: Now on that occasion the young deva Candimā had been seized by Rāhu, lord of the asuras.
sn2.9:1.3: Then, recollecting the Blessed One, the young deva Candimā on that occasion recited this verse:
sn2.9:2.1: “Let homage be to you, the Buddha! O hero,
sn2.9:3.1: Then, referring to the young deva Candimā, the Blessed One addressed Rāhu, lord of the asuras, in verse:
sn2.9:4.4: Buddhas have compassion for the world.”
sn2.9:5.1: Then Rāhu, lord of the asuras, released the young deva Candimā and hurriedly approached Vepacitti, lord of the asuras.  Having approached, shocked and terrified, he stood to one side.
sn2.9:5.2: Then, as he stood there, Vepacitti, lord of the asuras, addressed him in verse:
sn2.9:6.1: “Why, Rāhu, did you come in a hurry?
sn2.9:6.3: Having come as if in shock,
sn2.9:6.4: Why do you stand there frightened?”
sn2.9:7.1: “My head would have split in seven parts,
sn2.9:7.2: While living I would have found no ease,
sn2.9:7.3: If, when chanted over by the Buddha’s verse,
sn2.9:7.4: I had not let go of Candimā. ”
